entry.title: secure assigned bitcoin address directory
entry.summary: The email thread discusses various ideas and proposals related to Bitcoin development. One proposal involves adding a simple x509 digital signature to a Bitcoin address URL for authentication purposes. Another proposal is centered around a decentralized ledger of "device keys" that can provide advanced knowledge of public keys, allowing for secure transmission of person-to-person pay-to addresses without requiring a third-party certificate authority or prior dialogue. The discussion also touches on the issue of vanity addresses and the need for a secure way to verify ownership. While there are existing solutions like Namecoin, the proposed alternative aims to provide some of the important properties of the distributed ledger. Additionally, the use of proof-of-life for device keys is suggested as a means of expiring compromised keys. Overall, the email thread showcases ongoing conversations and ideas among developers in the Bitcoin space.
